billing.budget_calculator_help: The budget calculator will allow you to make a monthly budget based on your specific requirements.
billing.budget_description:
To prevent overspending on monthly consumables, we recommend setting a monthly economic limit.
Failing to set a limit may result in unexpected charges for any consumption beyond the allotted amount.
billing.budget_warning:
The current overconsumption will be billed this month.
The budget change will take effect next month.
billing.cancel-renewal: Cancel the renewal of your active subscription.
billing.cost_over_limits_description: If you exceed the limits on the payment tiers, the cost per usage will be applied

stash.create.user_prompts.prompt_help: Defines the way we want the system to act when we ask a question. Here we can define more specific rules, that could even override the defined behavior. For example, we could have a prompt that makes the system only give results in lists, or even ask to answer in a given language.
stash.create.user_prompts.system_help: Defines general personality traits of the assistant, or about how it should behave when answering questions/ during a conversation. For example, we could define that the system will answer as a health professional.
stash.create.visual_labeling.help: Allow to visually select some parts of the document layout and annotate them.

stash.settings.processes.classifier_info: In order to get accurate label search suggestions, existing content has to be labeled. As more content is labeled, training will improve. You can create new labels and classifications from the ontology page.
stash.settings.processes.ner_info: In order to recognize your custom entities automatically, existing content has to be annotated with your custom entities. As more content is annotated, training will improve. You can create new custom entities from the Insights page.
stash.settings.processes.paragraph-label: In order to label paragraphs automatically, existing paragraphs have to be labeled. As more content is labeled, training will improve. You can create new labels and classifications from the ontology page.
stash.settings.processes.resource-labele: In order to label resources automatically, existing resources have to be labeled. As more content is labeled, training will improve. You can create new labels and classifications from the ontology page.
stash.settings.processes.training.active: There is an active training that you can stop at any time. You will receive an email when it is complete.
stash.settings.processes.training.agreem: I accept the charges incurred by selecting this option
stash.settings.processes.training.consul: Consult all the data and the status of the trainings completed or in progress
stash.settings.processes.training.ner.co: Depending on your dataset, this training might not be effective. In order to assess if NER training is relevant in your case, please contact us.
stash.settings.processes.training.no-res: The training feature is not available on empty Knowledge Boxes.
stash.settings.processes.training.not-al: The training feature is not available on basic accounts.
stash.settings.processes.training.time_r: The time required to train is about {{hours}} hours which will be subtracted from the available hours.
